intro: Canthium brunneum, commonly known as the brown senna, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Canthium brunneum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments. It has been used traditionally in some regions for medicinal purposes.
